full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 148 of 236 1052 LC3Cmax5 Parkinson - direct. 1 (Government's Exhibits 223, 224, 225 received in evidence) 3 MS. COMEY: Thank you, your Honor. I you would now ask for permission to have the jurors turn to Government Exhibit 223. 6 THE COURT: Okay. Mr. Everdell. 7 MR. EVERDELL: No objection, your Honor. 8 THE COURT: Turn to GX223 in your binder. 9 MS. COMEY: I'm going to pause for a moment for the jurors to view that. Your Honor, I'd now ask for permission for the jurors to turn to Government Exhibit 224. 12 THE COURT: Okay. Mr. Everdell? Without objection, you may look at 224. 14 MS. COMEY: Now I would ask for permission for jurors to turn to Exhibit 225, please. 16 THE COURT: Mr. Everdell, without objection, jurors may look at 225? 18 MR. EVERDELL: No objection, your Honor. 19 THE COURT: Please, jurors, GX225. Okay. 20 MS. COMEY: Thank you. I will be referring back to the binder, so I ask the jurors be permitted to keep them, if they wish. 23 BY MS. COMEY: 24 Q. Mr. Parkinson, I'm now going to show you exhibits marked for identification as Government Exhibits 226 through 241 -- SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00018249
